intro: Medinilla cuneata, commonly known as the velvet tangerine or velvet plant, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Medinilla cuneata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it suitable for indoor or shaded outdoor environments.
